column4: I gave him that link earlier.. I think he's expecting linux to be like windows and not yet open to learning a new way.
just FYI.. If he'll listen to you more than me.. go for it.
looks like me pasting the link is beter than you pasting it :(
just had to hammer it into him twice I guess..
both use standard irc commands, so both are equally easy
isn't gaim now know as something else? like Pidgin
which is a great IM client but if he's using "gaim" then he's on an old release and needs a little coaxing.. I don't think gaim has the same irc plugins that Pidgin has currently
Solved has been working on this since last night.. doesn't want to install to /.. also playdeb.net has the latest version.. repos are out of date
the file Solved is using is tremulous-1.1.0-installer.x86.run   if you run: apt-cache policy tremulous , you will see it's 1.1.0-4.1build1 0   so the .run file is out of date too?
I guess it's the latest stable.. there is a 1.2 beta out
the user is trying to install the stable, which is in the repo
usually the repos are out of date for games.. but he did download direct
I agree.. installing from the repo is much easier
